feed.title: Category: The Week In Review | Hiking in Finland

entry.title: The Week In Review 241
entry.content:
Are you ready for summer nights in the mountains?

News

I’m all for free internet access, and I totally think that the Internet shouldn’t have a toll booth- Act before it is too late.

Climate change is going to drive a lot of change in the national parks.

Couple of days and the OutDoor 2016 starts. I already have been sharing some ultralight gear news over on Twitter so if you want know about UL tents, packs, shoes and garments, head over there!

Awesome! The LIFT transforms your bike into a Cargo Bike.

Outdoor-Spirit Podcast #31 is out! [German]

A new issue of Outdoor Enthusiast is available for free online!

Need more Titanium in your outdoor life.

Just today: 50% off on Black Diamond apparel and gear!

Trip reports

2016 has been pretty great so far.

Beardoh and SweetPea are now 57 Days on the PCT.

Carsten had a good course week in the mountains. [German]

A cool DIY Multisport Adventure in Alaska.

Antsa finished his 10 year project of paddling to all 74 Finnish Lighthouses - Congratulations!

A visit to Rairaikyo Canyon. [German]

Peter paddles in the Bothnian Sea National Park.

48 Hours in Croatia’s Capital of Cool.

Via Ferrata with Fear of Heights.

Looks fantastic: The 550 Miles of the Scottish Highland Trail.

Steve goes wild Camping with his 9 year old on Blencathra.

Adam’s new home looks sweet!

And James goes backpacking during Monsoon in the Dales, south to north.

Gear Reviews

Food: Dehydrated Cinnamon Carrot Shreds Recipe - Tasty!

Zegul Arrow Play Six Months Review.

Swift Hinterland Jr. Ranger Panniers.

Fits almost: Front Loading Basics.

Chris reviews the Salomon X-Ultra 2 GTX.

Review of the Salsa Pony Rustler.

Alex tests the double-layer Wrightsocks. [German]

Did this article make you want to go outside? Great! Be even more inspired more and subscribe to the Newsletter and follow along on Instagram and Youtube for more outdoorsy updates!

entry.title: The Week In Review 240
entry.content:
“If you go away on a summer day.”

News

Stevie Haston’s take on the Brexit and why it is shite.

The 840 g light Sierra Designs Backcountry Quilt is designed by Andrew Skurka and now available, starting at $199.

Freedom for the Wisent! [German]

Wanna go canyoning, climbing and rafting? Take part & win a sweet adventure weekend in Tyrol.

The Grand Canyon Trail Map T-Shirt.

Entomology and tenkara.

A complete tenkara set to get you started.

Check out the Psycho Vertical Kickstarter Campaign.

The Packrafting-Store is on Instagram.

Learn alpine climbing in Tyrol and win a complete alpine climbing outfit from Montura.

The Long-Distance Backpacking Review of June. [German]

Check out the Summer Stock-Up Sale with up to 50% off on Gear & Apparel.

Sign up for Campsaver.com’s newsletter and receive 10% off your first order!

Trip Reports

Part two of “I am not a big wall climber”.

Rich is running on the moors and sleeps in a bag.

A close call.

Satanique in the Bassin d´Argentiere looks like a fun route!

Liberty Crack.

Stevie and friends enjoy Days of Marvel.

Jill is all drugged up to go outside.

Be outdoors and learn English at the Sprachcamp Allgäu. [German]

The 3610 m high Üssere Barrhorn is the highest hiking peak of Europe. [German]

Brette Harrington’s Solo Soul Serenity.

The Gathering of the Clan

Gear Reviews

Kathrin’s LEJOG Gear List is worth nerding out over! [German]

Vegan Backpacking Tips and Tricks.

The Slap Bag.

Raf reviews the 5.10 Quantum.

A love letter to all the pack carried.

Plus Bikes: 27.5+ vs 29+.

Light things that bring smiles: Tread Lite Gear Cuben Fiber Dyneema X Grid Stuff Sack. [German]

Crotch Guard Review.

Did this article make you want to go outside? Great! Be even more inspired more and subscribe to the Newsletter and follow along on Instagram and Youtube for more outdoorsy updates!

entry.title: The Week In Review 239
entry.content:
“You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself in any direction you choose. You’re on your own, and you know what you know. And you are the guy who’ll decide where to go.” - Dr. Seuss

News

The OutDoor 2016 is less than three weeks away!

The Andrew Skurka designed Backcountry Quilt from Sierra Designs is now available.

It’s our duty as Americans to protect our national parks for the next hundred years.

Very awesome: Lael Wilcox wins Trans Am Bike Race 2016 in 18 days 10 minutes.

The Ultimate Weekend Warrior.

The Last Bastion of Outdoor Outlaws in the USA.

Three shirts, four pairs of trousers: Meet Japan’s ‘hardcore’ minimalists.

Are You Spending Enough Time Outside?

Sean Conway just finished the longest Triathlon, 4200 miles around Britain. Congratulations!

Big Salewa Photo Contest in which you can win a sleeping bag and tent!

Lili Marlene and misplaced nostalgia.

Discover innovative, ultralight gear from outdoor startups at Garage Grown Gear.

Just today you can get 20% off on gear from Haglöfs, Norrona, Bergans and Peak Performance at Bergfreunde.

Get 30% off on Patagonia gear at the Gear Coop.

Trip Reports

Beautiful: I am not a big wall climber.

Gerald hikes through the Drakensberge [German]

Jackie returns to Montana.

9 Tips to succeed on the PCT.

Adam leaves Alaska - I’ll miss his awesome photos.

Hiking with Lamas in the Ammergauer Alps. [German]

Fun: The art beneath the routes.

Peter enjoyed the 4th part of hos Vigu Sea Kayaking Guide Course.

With the packraft on the Tagliamento.

Backpacking Lake Aloha.

Mike hiked ths Juan de Fuca Marine Trail.

Nine days through the Blackforest. [German]

The Dirtbag Guide to Skaha.

Day 44 on the PCT.

Gear Reviews

Big Gear Outtakes Spring edition post came out this week.

Lael’s Trans Am Gear List.

Check out Christy’s Sierra High Route Gear List.

Raf reviews the RAB Nebula Parka.

Did this article make you want to go outside? Great! Be even more inspired more and subscribe to the Newsletter and follow along on Instagram and Youtube for more outdoorsy updates!

entry.title: The Week In Review 238
entry.content:
“What are men to rocks and mountains?” ― Jane Austen

News

Did you know that every second AT thru-hiker carries an ULA Equipment backpack? Now you do!

With the Luminoodle Light Rope you get a flexible and waterproof lightsource - ideal for tent and camp party use!

Enter to win a super-sweet Hyperlite Mountain Gear Expedition Kit!

More into climbing? Then there’s still time to enter the Genetic contest at Bergzeit and try your luck in winning a swell climbing outfit!

The Santa Monica Mountains’ 67-Mile ‘Backbone’ Trail is open!

Yo blogger colleagues, tired of the same old font on your blog? Good news: Google Fonts are free, easy to use and the website has just been re-designed to look mighty swell.

Kathrin answers Corinna’s 11 questions before her LEJOG. [German]

Trailblazer Interview with Jotaro Yoshida.

Human Remains in Jungle likely belong to missing adventurer Cody Roman Dial :(

The Grizzly Belongs on the Endangered Species List.

The Synthetic Black Rock Gear Hat is out!

Making the outdoors accessible for people with different abilities.

Outdoor enthusiasts find quality gear at the prices they like at CampSaver.com!

Get an Extra 25% Off One REI Outlet Item with Coupon Code: 25OFFJUNE.

Trip Reports

Ruth Gorgeous: multi-sport in the Alaska Range.

Sven and his daugther visited OAS Kids 2016. [German]

The Frayed Atlantic Edge.

Peter went for a canoe overnigher with the kids.

Exploring the Lammermuir Hills.

A quick glance back, before facing the music.

The pass of the flagstones.

Day 37 on the PCT.

Dent de Hernes, a lonely 4000 m peak. [German]

双六岳 3日目. [Japanese]

The Fulufjället Sufferfest.

The British are on Tour.

Gear Reviews

Paramo Cambia Brief Review.

A cool Camp Coffee Brewer Face-off.

Dave reviews the LaSportiva Bushido.

Amy suggests you ditch the Panniers for a Bike Trolley.

2016 ZPacks Duplex Tent Review.

A look at the Oveja Negra Super Wedgie.

The NEMO Bikepacking Kit.

Did this article make you want to go outside? Great! Be even more inspired more and subscribe to the Newsletter and follow along on Instagram and Youtube for more outdoorsy updates!

entry.title: The Week In Review 237
entry.content:
“Of all the paths you take in life make sure a few of them are dirt.”

News

The Bikepacking Framebag Manufacturer List got an update with three new European manufacturers!

GoLite is back in business and is now called My Trail Co.

Looking for a light summer quilt? outdoorline.sk has lightweight Cumulus sleeping bags and quilts for the summer season in stock!

Trail Designs will for the time being stop delivering their great stoves to shops in other countries as they can’t catch up with the large demand. If you want to support your local ultralight shop - buy a stove right now while they’re still in stock.

You can now support David on Patreon and get a Membership on Alex’s site. Great developments!

At Bergzeit you can win a lot of cool climbing stuff right now: A Genetic climbing outfit or an Edelrid climbing outfit!

The Four Key Elements of How To Tell a Story through Photos.

Stand on the Summit of Mountain Everest with the Mammut Project 360.

How much of your Workday do you actually spend working?

Who pays Influencers?

Respektiere deine Grenzen im Allgäu. [German]

Ute’s Tourbook for Kids goes into the 2nd Edition! [German]

The Test Run.

Get up to 40% Off on Gear & Clothing by Arc’teryx at Backcountry and Free 2-Day Shipping!

Save $20 when you spend $100 or more at REI Outlet with Coupon Code: OUTLET20.

Trip Reports

Climbing the Tanigawadake, Ojou-heki route (谷川岳凹状壁).

Martin hikes from Payerbach to Puchberg in Austria. [German]

The Rotterdam to Kathmandu Statistics.

Check out the Mawarime Daira Campsite.

Bikepacking Iceland: Crossing the Kjölur in Winter.

James goes Slackpacking.

A Sunday Microadventure.

The Mamores.

Great updat from Nick and Lael: Arizona to Baja to Alaska to Trans-Am: From the tropics to the arctic and everything therein.

Mark goes Wild camping with his daughter.

Up Bootts, Down Glen Boulder.

Noch mal richtig einen rausgehauen. [German]

Trekking in the colourful south of Peru. [German]

Mark pays a visit to the Korouoma Nature Reserve.

Gear Reviews

Traveling Light with Electronics.

Alex reviews the Speedster 30ml meths/alcohol backpacking stove.

Five Ten Kestrel Shoe Review.

Stefanie tests the Activeon cx Gold. [German]

A cool Micro Oil Lantern. [Japanese]

How to attach a skeg to your packraft. [German]

Gear for backpacking with your Dog.
